    • Method Detail

      • promptInteger

        public static int promptInteger(java.lang.String prompt,
                                int lowerBound,
                                int upperBound)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Prompts the user for an integer in a certain range with a given prompt. Asks again if the response is not an integer or within the range.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt to start the user with.
        lowerBound - The lower bound of valid integers, inclusive.
        upperBound - The upper bound of valid integers, exclusive.
        Returns:
        A valid integer given the specifications, chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if input is invalid

      • promptInteger

        public static int promptInteger(java.lang.String prompt)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Prompts the user for an integer with a given prompt. Asks again if the response is not an integer.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt to start the user with.
        Returns:
        A valid integer, chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if input is invalid

      • promptPositiveInteger

        public static int promptPositiveInteger(java.lang.String prompt)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Prompts the user for a positive integer with a given prompt. Asks again if the response is not a positive integer.
        Parameters:
        prompt - The prompt to start the user with.
        Returns:
        A valid integer, chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if input is invalid

                           throws java.io.IOException
        Prompts the user for a double with a given prompt. Asks again if the response is not a valid value.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt to start the user with.
        Returns:
        a valid double, chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if input is invalid

      • promptYesNo

        public static boolean promptYesNo(java.lang.String initialPrompt)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Prompts the user for a yes or no value, specified by y/n (not cap-sensitive).
        Parameters:
        initialPrompt - the prompt to ask the user at first.
        Returns:
        true if the user responses yes, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if input is invalid

      • promptLine

        Prompts the user for a string.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt to give the user
        Returns:
        the string entered by the user
        Throws:
